page.title: 07EASTWOOD GRANGE
page.content: Eastwood Grange was built in 1881 by Mr W E Chesterman,who was a steel manufacturer from Sheffield.There are 33 bedrooms,2 bathrooms, 7 public rooms,9 shower rooms and 12 toilets. It approx covers 10 acres. During the year,80_100 people use it for field study,60_65 for a Temperance Summer School and 60_65 for weekend Church and Youth groups.There are about 3,000 people who visit the Centre per year. The building is owned by The British Temperance League and Youth Conference Centres. There are 2 full time and 11 part-time workers. People come for the Temperance summer schools to study alcohol and drug problems,Schools for local history,geography and natural history,and Church groups for religion and social problems.Eastwood grange was so named because the surrounding area used to be densely wooded.
